cheatsheet.title: Add the Event Handler to a Test Case

intro.description: We will now add the Test Case as an Event Handler to another Test Case.

item.title: Create a new Test Case
item.description:
In the Test Case Browser, create a new Test Case.
Name the Test Case:
Simple Adder with Event Handler

item.title: Reference a Test Case to cause an error in the simple adder

subitem.label: Open the Test Case Editor for the "Simple Adder with Event Handler" Test Case.
In the Test Case Browser, open the category: "bound_modules_samples/01,02,03 Simple Adder Test Cases"
Drag the Test Case "Simple Adder Test" into the Test Case Editor for the "Simple Adder with Event Handler" Test Case.

item.title: Add parameters to the referenced Test Case
item.description:
In the properties view, enter a data set for the referenced Test Case which will cause an error, for example:
10, 2, 1
(10 and 2 do not equal 1)

subitem.label: Locate the "Reset" Test Case you created before.
Drag this Test Case into the "Event Handler" area at the bottom of the Test Case Editor for the "Simple Adder with Event Handler" Test Case.

In the dialog that appears, specify "Check Failed" as the error type and "Continue" as the reentry type. Click OK. This means that the Event Handler will be activated when a check failed action occurs. Once the Event Handler has been executed, the test will continue.
Save the Test Case and add it to a Test Suite. Specify "SimpleAdder" as the AUT in the Properties View for the Test Suite Editor.
Execute the Test Suite on the Simple Adder application, noticing how "File/reset" is selected from the menu after the error.
Check the Test Result View. The Event Handler you specified will have been activated.
